channel.title: Rate my Build
channel.description:
Buying myself a Christmas gift early...So why not another build...
My small worry is that I've never picked out my own choice of parts before...Clients usually tell me what I get and I build.
http://secure.newegg.ca/WishList/PublicWishDetail.aspx?WishListNumber=15365031
My price-range was 1500(Pretty close). Anybody have suggestions for better parts or Ideas of what I should get?
It's mostly for gaming if you never noticed.

item.title: Rate my Build
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“wyn10, post:41, topic:421302”][quote author=Brolapse link=topic=523966.msg3845738#msg3845738 date=1323612650]
I have the p8z68-vpro motherboard and it’s pretty awesome. I like the fact it has vga, dvi and hdmi outputs from the board which makes multi monitoring even better.

As for the case I’m astonished you would spend $199.99 on a case and then limit yourself to a 19.1" lcd screen. We’ve been debating on irc and it seems it’s pretty split on expensive cases - whether they are worth it or not. I spent £20 on my case and it fulfills all my needs. I’d say go for a cheaper case but make sure you read some reviews on it before buying so you actually know what you are getting.

So yeah my advice is go for a cheaper case and get a nicer monitor. I think nearly everyone can agree having a good monitor is a way higher priority than having a good case.
[/quote]

I’ve never liked having a huge monitor for gaming…Takes longer to look around. I got the idea of 19.1" as it’s what my school uses and I enjoy it. Not to small, not to big.

Cheaper != better deal

My first case was the shittiest, cheapest case I could find and it was absolutely horrendous, poor build quality, poor air flow, no space to put stuff and generally a massive eyesore. My current case cost me £55, it looks fucking brilliant, took me no time at all to install everything, tons of space inside… For the extra £30 i spent getting an extra case saved me so much work and hassle also who wants to take a dog ugly case to LAN?

My first case was some Shoe box. That was shitty I’ll tell ya lol.

Why such a small drive, do you have an external handy?

Yea I mostly use Externals for everything. So no need for a nice ssd/7200 Harddrive really.

And about the cases…I’ll prob stick with that one, as I know I’m gonna keep this desktop together for a pretty long time and it’s gonna be for quite a bit of lan.[/quote]Bitfenix Outlaw bro

Read full topic

As for the case I’m astonished you would spend $199.99 on a case and then limit yourself to a 19.1" lcd screen. item.title: Rate my Build
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

So it was worth it to you. My case works great, looks great, I’ve never had any cooling or airflow problems with it, and it cost $20 and ended up being free. I do have to use a screwdriver to install/remove hard drives and the like, but I don’t care. It doesn’t mean it was a bad choice.

Read full topic

item.title: Rate my Build
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:

Cheaper != better deal

My first case was the shittiest, cheapest case I could find and it was absolutely horrendous, poor build quality, poor air flow, no space to put stuff and generally a massive eyesore. My current case cost me £55, it looks fucking brilliant, took me no time at all to install everything, tons of space inside… For the extra £30 i spent getting an extra case saved me so much work and hassle also who wants to take a dog ugly case to LAN?

item.title: Rate my Build
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

So if I have money but decide to go with the better deal I’m a complete moron? Do I even need to respond to that?

The whole point is that just because something costs more, doesn’t mean that it is actually any better. A $20 case WORKS. Maybe you have to turn a screwdriver a few more times than if you spent $200 on the case, and if you don’t like using a screwdriver $180 worth, then maybe you should buy the $200 case. I’ll pass though.

Read full topic

item.description:

Hahaha he mad

Read full topic

item.title: Rate my Build
item.dc:creator: @Phillipe Phillipé
item.description:
@Phillipe wrote:

eczema3:

MITB just shut the fuck up about your “amazing $20 case”, seriously nobody gives a shit what you have to say about your case because its definitely inferior to what most people on here have in terms of computer cases. Yes most of our cases cost more but that’s because we’re paying for a quality build, tool-free installation, much better looking, quieter case. I can understand wanting to spend less on a case if you’re on a tight budget, but if you have the money but chose to get a cheaper case just because it’s cheaper then you’re a complete moron.

come at me bro

Read full topic

I have the p8z68-vpro motherboard and it’s pretty awesome. I like the fact it has vga, dvi and hdmi outputs from the board which makes multi monitoring even better.

As for the case I’m astonished you would spend $199.99 on a case and then limit yourself to a 19.1" lcd screen. We’ve been debating on irc and it seems it’s pretty split on expensive cases - whether they are worth it or not. I spent £20 on my case and it fulfills all my needs. I’d say go for a cheaper case but make sure you read some reviews on it before buying so you actually know what you are getting.

So yeah my advice is go for a cheaper case and get a nicer monitor. I think nearly everyone can agree having a good monitor is a way higher priority than having a good case.

Do you actually still think wireless mice are inferior to wired mice nowadays? I haven’t been able to notice a difference between them for years now.
[/quote]

wired > wireless when it comes to the mouse. Idk I can just feel the difference… could also be my pc as well :S[/quote]

Compared to what though? A decent and somewhat recent wireless mouse? Or last time you checked 6 years ago?

item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

Bling bling bling bling bling bling. I suggest always looking at reviews, because you will want a case with good air flow above everything else.

http://www.pureoverclock.com/article1387.html - Probably the best case you can find for such a low price when it comes to both ease of building, cable management and air flow.

item.title: Rate my Build
item.dc:creator: @wyn10 wyn10
item.description:
@wyn10 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:26, topic:421302”]Damn, just looked at newegg.ca and you guys pay out the ass for case shipping, sorry about that

This looks good for $25:

newegg.ca

GIGABYTE GZ-KF03B Black SGCC ATX Mid Tower Computer Case - Newegg.ca

Buy GIGABYTE GZ-KF03B Black SGCC ATX Mid Tower Computer Case with fast shipping and top-rated customer service. Newegg shopping upgraded ™

And if you want one with a handle (to be the envy of all at the lan party) $30:

newegg.ca

Linkworld 3210-04-C2628 Black/ Silver Steel ATX Mid Tower Computer Case -...

Buy Linkworld 3210-04-C2628 Black/ Silver Steel ATX Mid Tower Computer Case with fast shipping and top-rated customer service. Newegg shopping upgraded ™


edit:
Actually this handled one is cheaper when shipping is factored in:
newegg.ca

APEX TX-381-C Black Steel Micro ATX Tower Computer Case - Newegg.ca

Buy APEX TX-381-C Black Steel Micro ATX Tower Computer Case with fast shipping and top-rated customer service. Newegg shopping upgraded ™

To look at everything I’m looking at, I just clicked cases and sorted by price:

newegg.ca

ATX Computer Cases, ATX Mid Tower, ATX Mini Tower, ATX Desktop Computer Case,...

Newegg.ca offers the best prices on ATX Computer Cases, ATX Mid Towers, ATX Mini Towers, ATX Desktop Computer Cases, and Computer Cases with Side Panels with fast shipping and top-rated customer service. Newegg shopping upgraded ™

Use all that extra case money to get an SSD. With that fast of a computer, a 7200rpm hard drive will definitely be the bottleneck.[/quote]

I somewhat like the two with the handles; I giggled seeing the first one having a floppy on it (lol).

I wish I knew someone around here with a ssd so I can atleast see the difference compared to a 7200; I rarely hear anything about them, is the speed really worth the extra 20/30 bucks?

Also I did some googling over my idea of a acrylic case and found this => http://www.xoxide.com/sunbeam-9bay-acrylic-clear.html

Seeing the product images it’s quite exactly what I’m looking for; but still not sure about the site.

Thoughts?

Read full topic

item.title: Rate my Build
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

My current case I haven’t had to use a drill on (it was $20, but came with a dent, so I got it for free!). It was when I built computers during high school before newegg came about that I would cut holes in sides of computers and put plexiglass in there to make a window. I also used to put a fan in the top of the computer with a jigsaw.

item.title: Rate my Build
item.dc:creator: @wyn10 wyn10
item.description:
@wyn10 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:24, topic:421302”]I forgot to mention, at that price for the whole computer, why not spend a little less on the case and upgrade to a SSD hard drive?

You don’t need an expensive case to travel to LAN parties, I used to do it with my $20 case all the time, it even came with a handle on it! Best LAN party case ever! :)[/quote]

Ok I’ll take a look at cheaper cases. My second thought for a case would be a clear out of acrylic or something similar. Maybe that could be cheaper.

I’m still not sure about the SSD Harddrives. I mostly use external drives so I wouldn’t be sure if it’s really worth the 30 seconds better write/read speed at the price it’s at.

Read full topic

item.title: Rate my Build
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I forgot to mention, at that price for the whole computer, why not spend a little less on the case and upgrade to a SSD hard drive?

You don’t need an expensive case to travel to LAN parties, I used to do it with my $20 case all the time, it even came with a handle on it! Best LAN party case ever!

Read full topic

item.title: Rate my Build
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“wyn10, post:22, topic:421302”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=523966.msg3817727#msg3817727 date=1321493949]
If you are already spending $1500 on a computer, you might as well go with liquid cooling. I wouldn’t spend anywhere near $200 for a case, I just bought one to build a media center out of for $32 with free shipping. I also wouldn’t spend that for a motherboard either, why are you getting a motherboard with a built-in video card and also buying a video card? Just get one without a video card.

As to the video card, you could get 2 480s or 2 550s/560s for that price or less and probably better performance using them in SLI mode right? I’m not positive, but I’m pretty sure you could.

Looks like a great deal on that monitor though!

That hard drive looks extremely over priced, but then my brother did just tell me hard drive prices have doubled since the floods in Taiwan, so maybe that is why.

Overall, it’s pricey, but it will make a top-of-the-line machine for at least a few months.
[/quote]

Well after going through all of Newegg’s cases I chose that as I would be taking it to Lan party’s once in a while so I would want something small that I can change around very easily (Module Case).

I thought I picked a mother-board without a video-card; must have over-looked something…

I’m not planning on SlI’ing them yet as I wanna make sure I have the room after building before buying straight ahead. Also that HD is one of one the cheapest on the site.[/quote]The i7 motherboards all have integrated gpu’s because the cpu has a graphics chipset.

Read full topic

item.description:

I wouldn’t spend anywhere near $200 for a case, I just bought one to build a media center out of for $32 with free shipping. Well after going through all of Newegg’s cases I chose that as I would be taking it to Lan party’s once in a while so I would want something small that I can change around very easily (Module Case).

I thought I picked a mother-board without a video-card; must have over-looked something…

I’m not planning on SlI’ing them yet as I wanna make sure I have the room after building before buying straight ahead. Also that HD is one of one the cheapest on the site.

item.title: Rate my Build
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

If you are already spending $1500 on a computer, you might as well go with liquid cooling. I wouldn’t spend anywhere near $200 for a case, I just bought one to build a media center out of for $32 with free shipping. I also wouldn’t spend that for a motherboard either, why are you getting a motherboard with a built-in video card and also buying a video card? Just get one without a video card.

As to the video card, you could get 2 480s or 2 550s/560s for that price or less and probably better performance using them in SLI mode right? I’m not positive, but I’m pretty sure you could.

Looks like a great deal on that monitor though!

That hard drive looks extremely over priced, but then my brother did just tell me hard drive prices have doubled since the floods in Taiwan, so maybe that is why.

Overall, it’s pricey, but it will make a top-of-the-line machine for at least a few months.

Read full topic

item.title: Rate my Build
item.dc:creator: @wyn10 wyn10
item.description:
@wyn10 wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:18, topic:421302”][quote author=wyn10 link=topic=523966.msg3816697#msg3816697 date=1321400893]
So would I need the cpu cooler?
[/quote]

I really would recommend something better than the stock cooler, the Nh-D14 is overkill but you can get plenty of $40-60 coolers that are much better than stock.

The Thermaltake Frio is a fairly decent cooler and it’s only $60. A few degrees warmer than the Nh-D14 but much better than stock.

That thing is ridiculously huge, i probably couldn’t fit it due to cooling blocks on the motherboard

It’s huge but it does have a lot of clearance off the board. PS, they have a nifty guide showing what ram is compatible.

With the Nh-D14 with both fans at 900rpm, at stock(3.7ghz/1.115 volts) my temps are never higher than 45c under load and oced to 4.5ghz with 1.300 volts and running prime95 for 20 minutes the temps were stable around 55-60c for all cores. Compare that to 86c/63c Speljohan and Radeon get with stock coolers on stock volts. (I know they both have the 2600k and I only have the 2500k but the chips have very similar temps)[/quote]

After reading the reviews for it I decided to go with that. I really wans’t sure if the D14 would fit.

Someone told me I should just go liquid cooling.

Read full topic

Compare that to 86c/63c Speljohan and Radeon get with stock coolers on stock volts. (I know they both have the 2600k and I only have the 2500k but the chips have very similar temps)[/quote]Im jus buying a H100 instead.

item.description:

wyn10:

So would I need the cpu cooler?

I really would recommend something better than the stock cooler, the Nh-D14 is overkill but you can get plenty of $40-60 coolers that are much better than stock.

The Thermaltake Frio is a fairly decent cooler and it’s only $60. A few degrees warmer than the Nh-D14 but much better than stock.

Speljohan:

That thing is ridiculously huge, i probably couldn’t fit it due to cooling blocks on the motherboard

It’s huge but it does have a lot of clearance off the board. PS, they have a nifty guide showing what ram is compatible.

With the Nh-D14 with both fans at 900rpm, at stock(3.7ghz/1.115 volts) my temps are never higher than 45c under load and oced to 4.5ghz with 1.300 volts and running prime95 for 20 minutes the temps were stable around 55-60c for all cores. Compare that to 86c/63c Speljohan and Radeon get with stock coolers on stock volts. (I know they both have the 2600k and I only have the 2500k but the chips have very similar temps)
